titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Bernard Perlin Papers
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Wednesday January 23, 2019 at 05:09

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Correspondence, artwork, photographs, negatives, and other printed material.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Box 34 (videocassettes): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Bernard Perlin Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Bernard Perlin Papers. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection received a basic level of processing in 2014, including rehousing and in some instances minimal organization. Various acquisitions associated with the collection have not been merged and organized as a whole. Each acquisition is described separately in the contents list below, identified by a unique call number and titled according to month and year of acquisition.

The finding aid for this collection is compiled from individual preliminary lists for each acquisition that were created at or around the time of receipt by the library. The preliminary lists were migrated to comply with current archival descriptive standards and merged into a single file in 2007-2008. As part of the migration, modifications were made to the formatting of individual lists; however, the content of the lists was neither modified nor verified.

As a rule, descriptive information found in the Collection Contents section is drawn in large part from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.
This collection includes materials previously identified by the call numbers Uncat MSS 851, Uncat ZA File 710, Uncat MSS 970, and Uncat MSS 1250.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence; artwork, including sketchbooks and two busts; photographs and negatives; printed material, including clippings; and other related papers documenting the life and work of the artist Bernard Perlin. Material pertaining to Perlin's work creating propaganda art as an artist-correspondent for Fortune and Life magazines during the Second World War is present, as is material documenting his later landscape and figurative painting.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into four groupings: February 2006 Acquisition, May 2007 Acquisition, September 2007 Acquisition, and November 2010 Acquisition.

Material within this collection has been organized by acquisition reflecting the fact that the collection has been acquired in increments over time. In order to locate all relevant material within this collection, researchers will need to consult each acquisition described in the Collection Contents section.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Bernard Perlin (1918-2014) was an American painter and an artist-correspondent for Life and Fortune magazines during World War II. He began working as an artist in 1938, when he received a fellowship to paint in Poland; he then painted murals for the United States Treasury Department and the United States Maritime Commission.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence; artwork, including sketchbooks and 2 busts; photographs and negatives; printed material, including clippings; and other papers by or relating to Bernard Perlin.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This portion of the collection is organized into ten series: Correspondence, 1940-2005; Diaries, Notebooks, and Calendars, 1945-2005; Biographical and Financial Papers, 1940-2002; Photographs, 1945-2001; Research Files on Other Artists, 1991-2002; Papers Relating to Perlin's Artwork, 1942-1990; Printed Material and Clippings, 1944-2005; Memorabilia and Audiovisual Material, 1993, 1995; Oversize, 1952-1995; Oversize Folders, 1943.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes keys, unidentified seals, rocks, war correspondent badges, and a flag. A razor blade, metal pen nib, and unidentified object were removed from the collection, due to preservation concerns; these items are documented with photographic surrogates in the box.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

scopecontent.p: Telephone log books, printed material, including clippings, and computer printouts.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This portion of the collection is arranged chronologically.
